message_1: What is the smallest even number greater than 2 that cannot be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers? (This is one statement of Goldbach's Conjecture.)
message_2: Goldbach's Conjecture, which remains unproven, states that every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers. Since the conjecture has not been disproven, there is currently no known smallest even number greater than 2 that cannot be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.
